channel.title: Context Engineering Daily
channel.description: Daily news and research updates in AI Context Engineering, Prompt Engineering, RAG, and LLM development

item.title: Iti-Validator: A Guardrail Framework for Validating and Correcting LLM-Generated Itineraries
item.description: arXiv:2510.24719v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The rapid advancement of Large Language Models (LLMs) has enabled them to generate complex, multi-step plans and itineraries. However, these generated plans often lack temporal and spatial consistency, particularly in scenarios involving physical trav...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> research, API, framework, experiment, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Confidence is Not Competence
item.description: arXiv:2510.24772v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models (LLMs) often exhibit a puzzling disconnect between their asserted confidence and actual problem-solving competence. We offer a mechanistic account of this decoupling by analyzing the geometry of internal states across two phases ...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> model, arxiv, reasoning, large language model, LLM | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.description: arXiv:2510.25014v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) enable dynamic game interactions but fail to follow essential procedural flows in rule-governed trading systems, eroding player trust. item.title: Context-Engineering - "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." â€” Andrej Karpathy. item.title: mcp-context-forge - A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. Converts REST API endpoints to MCP, composes virtual MCP servers with added security and observability, and converts between protocols (stdio, SSE, Streamable HTTP).
item.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. item.title: KAG - KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.
item.description: KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> GitHub | <strong>Keywords:</strong> vector, framework, retrieval, RAG, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
